_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan - Executive Summary



Facility:    West Central AGRIServices - Adrian

Location:    438 NW Cty Rd 11002, Adrian, Mo.

Contact:     Randy Morris

Phone:             816-297-2138





1. The Facility Policy



West Central AGRIServices and the employees of the West Central AGRIServices located south of Adrian are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the Bates County LEPC, and other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.



2.  Stationary Source and Regulated Substance Handled



The facility operates an anhydrous ammonia storage facility and sells the regulated substance, anhydrous ammonia, for direct application as a crop nutrient.



3. The Accidental Release Prevention Program



The Accidental Release Prevention Program for the location consists of following the provisions of:



a.    40 CFR Part 68

b.    OSHA 29 CFR 1910.111

c.    Missouri Anhydrous Ammonia Law

d.    CGA G.2.1 - 2014

e.    ANSI K61.1 - 1999



4. The Five-year Accident History



There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that: have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.



5. The Emergency Response Program.



a The facility has a written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA

Standard, 29 CFR 1910.38;



b The facility provided State and Local authorities with the emergency

planning and community right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA);



c Employees will not respond to any releases other than to activate an emergency shut-off valve while evacuating the facility if it is safe for them to do so. Local emergency responders will be notified to control any release.

6. Planned changes to improve safety



Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility.  Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the condition and operation of the facility and improvements are made where warranted.



3/26/18
